<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/07/app-revive-air-travel?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pining for Panda Express?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Plane taking off on a phone" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzA2L3BsYW5lX3Rha2luZ19vZmZfb25fYV9waG9uZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We know the seven-month air travel freeze has you nostalgic for $8 water bottles, damp sandwiches, and leg cramps. Good news: Those dreams <a href="https://www.thenational.ae/lifestyle/travel/commonpass-the-app-pegged-as-the-answer-to-covid-free-air-travel-to-begin-trial-process-1.1090012?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could come true</a> courtesy of a new app. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">CommonPass, which was created by tech nonprofit The Commons Project and the World Economic Forum, will be used on a trial basis on Cathay Pacific flights between Hong Kong and Singapore today. Later in the month, United will test it out on flights between Newark and London’s Heathrow. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What CommonPass does</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It takes countries’ wildly divergent requirements for air travel safety and lets passengers demonstrate they’re good to go—in most cases, by testing negative for Covid-19. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It could solve a major obstacle to flying in the Covid era. Those different protocols for proving you’re virus-free have caused confusion for both travelers and airlines, and everyone from the industry to the CDC has been calling for a </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/8d603248-6884-4081-9256-8c5b2f2827ba?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">global, uniform system</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it works:</strong> Passengers get tested at CommonPass-supported labs, then upload their results to the app. If you’re negative, the app spits out a QR code you can then wield at Newark to certify you aren’t carrying the virus. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Or at least...you weren’t when you got tested. Critics have <a href="https://fortune.com/2020/10/06/commonpass-covid-air-travel-coronavirus-safety-tech-startup/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pointed out</a> holes in the CommonPass plan, including 1) the possibility of getting infected after being tested and 2) the tests still aren’t 100% accurate. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plus, it’s hard to overstate the power of the heebie-jeebies. People are reluctant to travel by plane these days, testing app or no testing app. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Still, it’s a potential jump-start for the sputtering air travel sector, which has been the subject of intense </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-airlines/u-s-airlines-await-fresh-shot-at-federal-aid-as-pelosi-mnuchin-talk-idUSKBN26S2AL?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">emergency aid negotiations</a></span><span> these past few days. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Airports and airlines are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/can-airport-covid-testing-get-people-flying-again-11602075315?mod=hp_featst_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spinning up</a> their own testing schemes as safety-improving- and heebie-jeebie-reducing measures. Airports in Oakland and Hartford, CT,  are opening their own testing centers, while Hawaiian Airlines is offering passengers at-home saliva tests for $150. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORKPLACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/07/slack-unveils-new-features-including-stories?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Slack Hits the Lab
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Slack sneakers" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzA3L3NsYWNrX3NuZWFrZXJzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Cole Haan</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Workplace communication tool Slack was handed a golden opportunity when companies went remote in March. Since then, it’s been experimenting with new features to help it meet the moment. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It unveiled a few of them yesterday at its Frontiers conference. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Collaboration: </strong></span><span>Because swapping Homer GIFs with your coworkers isn’t distracting enough, Slack is making it </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/10/07/slack-introduces-new-features-to-ease-messaging-between-business-partners/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">easier</a></span><span> for you to message someone outside your company. The goal is to allow business partners to collaborate more efficiently. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Stories: </strong></span><span>Slack’s adding a Stories feature by the end of 2020, because of course it is. “There was a joke going around that soon all software will have it,” CEO Stewart Butterfield </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/7/21505519/slack-instagram-stories-push-to-talk-audio-calls-new-features?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told The Verge</a></span><span>, but “...it’s an idea that’s time has come.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Sneakers: </strong></span><span>Not a typo. Footwear brand Cole Haan and Slack announced a collab on limited-edition sneakers, which you can see in the image above. Thoughts?</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Slack is in a software scrum with Microsoft and Google, both of which are releasing new features or <a href="https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2020/10/google-rebrands-g-suite-as-google-workplace-ships-new-multi-colored-icons/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rebranding</a> to capture your company’s internal communications budget.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MACROECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/07/rise-extreme-poverty-reverses-decades-progress?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Rise in Extreme Poverty Reverses Decades of Progress
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An image of shacks on the water " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzA4L2FuX2ltYWdlX29mX3NoYWNrc19vbl90aGVfd2F0ZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Paula Bronstein/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the World Bank said an additional 88 million to 115 million people will fall into <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-imf-worldbank-poverty/coronavirus-may-push-150-million-people-into-extreme-poverty-world-bank-idUSKBN26S2RV?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">extreme poverty</a> this year due to the pandemic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>Because it marks the first uptick in extreme poverty in about 20 years. Powerful economic growth in countries like China and India allowed hundreds of millions of people to raise their living standards over the past couple of decades.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Extreme poverty is defined as living on an income of $1.90 or less a day, or ~$700/year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s driving the reversal? </strong>A <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-has-thrown-around-100-million-people-into-extreme-poverty-world-bank-estimates-11602086400?mod=pls_whats_news_us_business_f&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">greater number</a> of city residents are falling into extreme poverty, whereas before the pandemic it was mostly concentrated in rural areas. The World Bank also reported a larger share of extreme poverty in middle-income countries and among people with higher education levels. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>As progress in eliminating extreme poverty suffers its worst setback in decades, the richest North Americans have already <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/richest-americans-recovered-most-wealth-after-covid-11602071777?mod=hp_listc_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recovered</a> most of their wealth lost during the pandemic, according to a new report from Wealth-X.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We don’t simply wake up with glowing, refreshed, and rejuvenated skin. We weren’t born with it. The Essence is an innovative <strong style="color:#000">3-in-1 formula that combines the properties of a gentle exfoliant, a purifying toner, and a refreshing, hydrating essence </strong>to reveal smoother, more vibrant skin. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Developed by the pioneering German scientist and powered by his TFC8® skincare technology, Augustinus Bader’s The Essence streamlines all your post-cleanse needs into a single step. Now you can say <em>auf Wiedersehen</em> to numerous unnecessary products and <em>hallo</em> to <a href="https://augustinusbader.com/us/en/the-essence?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter_08-10-20&utm_campaign=primary_bodylink_Essence1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">healthier-looking skin without the hassle</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Essence combines Augustinus Bader’s <a href="https://augustinusbader.com/us/en/the-essence?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter_08-10-20&utm_campaign=primary_bodylink_Essence1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">patented skincare technology</a> with exfoliating hydroxy acids and gentle, high-potency botanicals,<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>so it’s no surprise that <strong style="color:#000">96% agree skin’s texture looks and feels more even.</strong></p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/07/live-streaming-platforms-led-twitch-massive-third-quarter?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Stream labs chart showing Twitch viewership numbers " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzA5L3N0cmVhbV9sYWJzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Streamlabs</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Audiences watched <a href="https://streamlabs.com/content-hub/post/streamlabs-and-stream-hatchet-q3-2020-live-streaming-industry-report?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">7.46 billion hours</a> of live-streamed content in Q3, according to a new report from streaming software company Streamlabs. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For some context, there are 876,000 hours in a century. That means roughly 8,447 centuries of content was consumed across all streaming platforms in just three months. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Twitch put the team on its back </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Amazon-owned behemoth, which is primarily used to watch videogame streams, accounted for 63% of total hours watched and <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/07/amazon-twitch-dominates-game-streaming-after-microsoft-mixer-shutdown.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">91% of hours streamed</a>. After Microsoft’s Mixer shut down in July, YouTube (5.5%) and Facebook (3.4%) are the only other challengers on Twitch’s radar. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>When Microsoft pulled the plug on Mixer, it encouraged its viewers to move over to Facebook Gaming. Instead, Twitch’s viewership jumped 15%, as most of Mixer’s big-name streamers, like Ninja, </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-07/microsoft-s-mixer-streamers-flock-to-twitch-instead-of-facebook?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">returned</a></span><span> to the market leader.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Total hours watched on Twitch actually fell in Q3 compared to the previous quarter, when widespread lockdowns were in effect. But year-over-year, its streaming numbers are healthier than a quinoa bowl, up 91%.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/07/ocean-spray-fleetwood-mac-capitalize-viral-tiktok-video?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Best Thing to Happen to Ocean Spray Since Cran-Apple
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Man on skateboard drinking Ocean Spray " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzEwL3Rpa3Rva19ndXlfZHJpbmtpbmdfb2NlYW5fc3ByYXkucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><span>420DoggFace208 on </span>TikTok</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you caught someone actually smiling while looking at their phone recently, chances are they were watching the <a href="https://twitter.com/doggface208/status/1310295094545641472?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">TikTok video</a> of a man cruising on a skateboard, mouthing the lyrics to Fleetwood Mac’s “Dreams” while sipping Ocean Spray juice. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Nathan Apodaca, who goes by 420DoggFace208 on TikTok, first posted the video in September. It went megaviral, racking up over 26.9 million views on TikTok and countless more across other social media platforms. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Fleetwood Mac</span><span><em> </em></span><span>drummer </span><span><a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@mickfleetwood/video/6879849755204259077?referer_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.adweek.com%2F&referer_video_id=6879849755204259077&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mick Fleetwood</a></span><span> and Ocean Spray CEO </span><span><a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@tomhayes603/video/6880575066434800902?referer_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.adweek.com%2F&referer_video_id=6880575066434800902&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tom Hayes</a></span><span> both jumped on the trend by posting similar videos of themselves vibing out. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Then, on Tuesday, Ocean Spray gave Apodaca a </span><span><a href="https://people.com/food/ocean-spray-gives-tiktok-star-a-new-truck-following-fleetwood-mac-cranberry-juice-viral-video/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">truck</a></span><span> for his role as the company’s unexpected brand ambassador. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It was a windfall for everyone involved</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, Fleetwood Mac’s “Dreams” had its <a href="https://www-billboard-com.cdn.ampproject.org/c/s/www.billboard.com/amp/articles/business/chart-beat/9460805/fleetwood-mac-dream-biggest-streaming-week-ever-viral-tiktok-video/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best streaming week ever</a>, the #oceanspray tag on TikTok has over 25 million views (the video didn’t even use that hashtag), and Apadoca got a new, cranberry red Nissan Titan PRO-4X.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This is one of the most concrete examples of TikTok’s ability to manufacture celebrities and drive cultural moments. Every brand is hoping they’re the next Ocean Spray.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew's Bookshelf
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODIvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every other Thursday, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew’s Bookshelf</a> brings you a selection of our favorite business-related reads. Here are some new releases we're excited about.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780358216766?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>How I Built This</em></a></span><span><em> </em></span><span>by Guy Raz distills the best lessons in entrepreneurship from NPR’s hit podcast. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781631496103?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>If Then</em></a></span><span> by historian Jill Lepore tells the forgotten tale of the Simulmatics Corporation, a Cold War-era tech company.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780306846663?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Blood and Oil</em></a></span><span> by WSJ reporters Bradley Hope and Justin Scheck lifts the curtain on Mohammed bin Salman, Saudi Arabia’s controversial crown prince. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780553459395?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Secret Life of Groceries</em></a></span><span> by Benjamin Lorr describes the human costs of stocking and running an American supermarket.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780525522621?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Biggest Bluff</em></a></span><span><em> </em></span><span>shares writer and psychology Ph.D Maria Konnikova’s unconventional journey of hacking her way to professional poker leagues.</span>
</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Written by
<a href="https://twitter.com/ElizaCarter34" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Eliza Carter</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/tobydoyhowell" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Toby Howell</a>, and <a href="https://twitter.com/Neal_Freyman" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Neal Freyman</a>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStocks decided to take the glass-half-full approach following President Trump’s mixed messages around emergency aid Tuesday. The Dow had its best \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/06/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eone-day gain\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since July.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2020: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMike Pence and Kamala Harris faced off in a (much more tame) \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2020-election/pence-harris-meet-vice-presidential-debate-covid-19-cases-surge-n1242451?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eVP debate\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e last night. They touched on issues including the Trump administration's coronavirus response, the economic recession, climate change, and China. Oh, and there was a fly that lots of people were making jokes about on the internet. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nAVIATION\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/07/app-revive-air-travel?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nPining for Panda Express?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Plane taking off on a phone\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzA2L3BsYW5lX3Rha2luZ19vZmZfb25fYV9waG9uZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe know the seven-month air travel freeze has you nostalgic for $8 water bottles, damp sandwiches, and leg cramps. Good news: Those dreams \u003ca href=\"https://www.thenational.ae/lifestyle/travel/commonpass-the-app-pegged-as-the-answer-to-covid-free-air-travel-to-begin-trial-process-1.1090012?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecould come true\u003c/a\u003e courtesy of a new app. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCommonPass, which was created by tech nonprofit The Commons Project and the World Economic Forum, will be used on a trial basis on Cathay Pacific flights between Hong Kong and Singapore today. Later in the month, United will test it out on flights between Newark and London’s Heathrow. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat CommonPass does\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt takes countries’ wildly divergent requirements for air travel safety and lets passengers demonstrate they’re good to go—in most cases, by testing negative for Covid-19. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt could solve a major obstacle to flying in the Covid era. Those different protocols for proving you’re virus-free have caused confusion for both travelers and airlines, and everyone from the industry to the CDC has been calling for a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/8d603248-6884-4081-9256-8c5b2f2827ba?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eglobal, uniform system\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it works:\u003c/strong\u003e Passengers get tested at CommonPass-supported labs, then upload their results to the app. If you’re negative, the app spits out a QR code you can then wield at Newark to certify you aren’t carrying the virus. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOr at least...you weren’t when you got tested. Critics have \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2020/10/06/commonpass-covid-air-travel-coronavirus-safety-tech-startup/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epointed out\u003c/a\u003e holes in the CommonPass plan, including 1) the possibility of getting infected after being tested and 2) the tests still aren’t 100% accurate. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePlus, it’s hard to overstate the power of the heebie-jeebies. People are reluctant to travel by plane these days, testing app or no testing app. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eStill, it’s a potential jump-start for the sputtering air travel sector, which has been the subject of intense \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-airlines/u-s-airlines-await-fresh-shot-at-federal-aid-as-pelosi-mnuchin-talk-idUSKBN26S2AL?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eemergency aid negotiations\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e these past few days. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAirports and airlines are \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/can-airport-covid-testing-get-people-flying-again-11602075315?mod=hp_featst_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espinning up\u003c/a\u003e their own testing schemes as safety-improving- and heebie-jeebie-reducing measures. Airports in Oakland and Hartford, CT,  are opening their own testing centers, while Hawaiian Airlines is offering passengers at-home saliva tests for $150. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F10%2F07%2Fapp-revive-air-travel\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzA3L3NsYWNrX3NuZWFrZXJzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eCole Haan\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWorkplace communication tool Slack was handed a golden opportunity when companies went remote in March. Since then, it’s been experimenting with new features to help it meet the moment. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt unveiled a few of them yesterday at its Frontiers conference. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCollaboration: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBecause swapping Homer GIFs with your coworkers isn’t distracting enough, Slack is making it \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/10/07/slack-introduces-new-features-to-ease-messaging-between-business-partners/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeasier\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for you to message someone outside your company. The goal is to allow business partners to collaborate more efficiently. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStories: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSlack’s adding a Stories feature by the end of 2020, because of course it is. “There was a joke going around that soon all software will have it,” CEO Stewart Butterfield \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/7/21505519/slack-instagram-stories-push-to-talk-audio-calls-new-features?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold The Verge\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, but “...it’s an idea that’s time has come.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSneakers: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNot a typo. Footwear brand Cole Haan and Slack announced a collab on limited-edition sneakers, which you can see in the image above. Thoughts?\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eSlack is in a software scrum with Microsoft and Google, both of which are releasing new features or \u003ca href=\"https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2020/10/google-rebrands-g-suite-as-google-workplace-ships-new-multi-colored-icons/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erebranding\u003c/a\u003e to capture your company’s internal communications budget.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the World Bank said an additional 88 million to 115 million people will fall into \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-imf-worldbank-poverty/coronavirus-may-push-150-million-people-into-extreme-poverty-world-bank-idUSKBN26S2RV?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eextreme poverty\u003c/a\u003e this year due to the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eBecause it marks the first uptick in extreme poverty in about 20 years. Powerful economic growth in countries like China and India allowed hundreds of millions of people to raise their living standards over the past couple of decades.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eExtreme poverty is defined as living on an income of $1.90 or less a day, or ~$700/year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s driving the reversal? \u003c/strong\u003eA \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-has-thrown-around-100-million-people-into-extreme-poverty-world-bank-estimates-11602086400?mod=pls_whats_news_us_business_f\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egreater number\u003c/a\u003e of city residents are falling into extreme poverty, whereas before the pandemic it was mostly concentrated in rural areas. The World Bank also reported a larger share of extreme poverty in middle-income countries and among people with higher education levels. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eAs progress in eliminating extreme poverty suffers its worst style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecovered\u003c/a\u003e most of their wealth lost during the pandemic, according to a new report from href=\"https://streamlabs.com/content-hub/post/streamlabs-and-stream-hatchet-q3-2020-live-streaming-industry-report?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e7.46 billion hours\u003c/a\u003e of live-streamed content in Q3, according to a new report from streaming software company Streamlabs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor some context, there are 876,000 hours in a century. That means roughly 8,447 centuries of content was consumed across all streaming platforms in just three months. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTwitch put the team on its back \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Amazon-owned behemoth, which is primarily used to watch videogame streams, accounted for 63% of total hours watched and \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/07/amazon-twitch-dominates-game-streaming-after-microsoft-mixer-shutdown.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e91% of hours streamed\u003c/a\u003e. After Microsoft’s Mixer shut down in July, YouTube (5.5%) and Facebook (3.4%) are the only other challengers on Twitch’s radar. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhen Microsoft pulled the plug on Mixer, it encouraged its viewers to move over to Facebook Gaming. Instead, Twitch’s viewership jumped 15%, as most of Mixer’s big-name streamers, like Ninja, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-07/microsoft-s-mixer-streamers-flock-to-twitch-instead-of-facebook?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereturned\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to the market leader.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eTotal hours watched on Twitch actually fell in Q3 compared to the previous quarter, when widespread lockdowns were in effect.
